newsitem.title: USA: Riverside, Calif. seeks plan to avert more defaults.
newsitem.headline: Riverside, Calif. seeks plan to avert more defaults.

text.p: Riverside County, Calif. finance officials are developing a plan to restructure a troubled bond issue to avert future payment problems following a default this week, a county official said on Wednesday.

Gregg Marrama, deputy county executive officer, said a team was working on a plan to avert future defaults. The plan could include refundings. "The county is committed to resolving the problems," he said.
Riverside County Community Facilities District 88-8 sold about $24 million of Mello-Roos bonds in 1990 to finance street, water, storm-drain and sewer improvements.
